question: 2. The Phases of formal review process is mentioned below arrange them in the correct order.
sub_question:
i. Planning
ii. Review Meeting
iii. Rework
iv. Individual Preparations
v. Kick Off
vi. Follow Up

answers.A: i, ii, iii, iv, v, vi
answers.B: vi, i, ii, iii, iv, v
answers.C: i, v, iv, ii, iii, vi

question: Which of the following is a MAJOR task of test planning?

answers.A: Scheduling test analysis and design tasks.

question: Based on the IEEE Standard for Software Test Documentation (IEEE Std 829 - 1998), which of the following sections are part of the test summary report?
sub_question:
a) Summary
b) Test incident report identifier
c) Test deliverables
d) Risks and contingencies
e) Variances
f) Approvals
g) Output specifications

question: Which is a potential product risk factor?

answers.A: A. Failure of third party vendor

question: Who typically use static analysis tools?
Who would USUALLY perform debugging activities?
Which of the following would you NOT usually find on a software incident report?

answers.A: The name and / or organisational position of the person raising the problem.
answers.B: Version of the Software Under Test.
answers.C: Suggestions as to how to fix the problem.

question: Which of the following defines the expected results of a test?
Some tools are geared more for developer use. For the 5 tools listed, which statement BEST details those for developers
sub_question:
i) Performance testing tools.
ii) Coverage measurement tools.
iii) Test comparators.
iv) Dynamic analysis tools.
v) Incident management tools.

answers.A: i, iii. and iv. are more for developers.
answers.B: ii. and iv. are more for developers.
answers.C: ii, iii and iv. are more for developers.
answers.D: ii. and iii. are more for developers.

question: Which of the following is correct?

answers.A: Impact analysis assesses the effect on the system of a defect found in regression testing.
answers.B: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a new person joining the regression test team.
answers.C: Impact analysis assesses whether or not a defect found in regression testing has been fixed correctly.
answers.D: Impact analysis assesses the effect of a change to the system to determine how much regression testing to do.

question: In software testing what is the main purpose of exit criteria?

answers.A: To enhance the security of the system
answers.B: To prevent the endless loops in code.
answers.C: To swerve as an alternative or "Plan-B"
answers.D: To define when to stop testing

question: Which of the following is a KEY test closure task?

answers.C: Assessing the need for additional tests

question: What is beta testing?

answers.A: Testing performed by potential customers at the developers location.
answers.B: Testing performed by potential customers at their own locations.
answers.C: Testing performed by product developers at the customer's location.
answers.D: Testing performed by product developers at their own locations.

question: Given the following fragment of code, how many tests are required for 100% decision coverage?
sub_question:
if width > length
biggest_dimension = width
if height > width
then
biggest_dimension = height
end_if
else
biggest_dimension = length
if height > length
then
biggest_dimension = height
end_if
end_if

question: You have designed test cases to provide 100% statement and 100% decision coverage for the following fragment of code.
sub_question:
if width > length
then
biggest_dimension = width
else
biggest_dimension = length
end_if
The following has been added to the bottom of the code fragment above.

print "Biggest dimension is " & biggest_dimension
print "Width: " & width
print "Length: " & length

How many more test cases are required?

answers.A: One more test case will be required for 100 % decision coverage.
answers.B: Two more test cases will be required for 100% statement coverage, one of which will be used to provide 100% decision coverage.
answers.C: None, existing test cases can be used.
answers.D: One more test case will be required for 100% statement coverage.

question: Which defects are OFTEN much cheaper to remove?

answers.D: Minor defects that were found by users

question: Which activity in the fundamental test process creates test suites for efficient test execution?
Which of the following is TRUE?

answers.A: Confirmation testing is testing fixes to a set of defects and Regression testing is testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes.
answers.B: Confirmation testing is testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes and Regression testing is testing fixes to a set of defects.
answers.C: Confirmation testing and Regression testing are both testing to establish whether any defects have been introduced as a result of changes.
answers.D: Confirmation testing and Regression testing are both testing fixes to a set of defects.

question: When should configuration management procedures be implemented?
Which of the following are characteristic of regression testing ?
sub_question:
i) Regression testing is run ONLY once
ii) Regression testing is used after fixes have been made
iii) Regression testing is often automated
iv) Regression tests need not be maintained

question: Which of the problems below BEST characterize a result of software failure?
Which of the following activities should be performed during the selection and implementation of a testing tool?
sub_question:
i) Investigate the organisation's test process.
ii) Conduct a proof of concept.
iii) Implement the selected tool on a project behind schedule to save time.
iv) Identify coaching and mentoring requirements for the use of the selected tool.

question: What is the MAIN benefit of designing tests early in the life cycle?

answers.A: It is cheaper than designing tests during the test phases.
answers.B: It helps prevent defects from being introduced into the code.
answers.C: Tests designed early are more effective than tests designed later.
answers.D: It saves time during the testing phases when testers are busy.

question: Which of the following benefits are MOST likely to be achieved by using test tools?
sub_question:
i) Easy to access information about tests and testing.
ii) Reduced maintenance of testware.
iii) Easy and cheap to implement.
iv) Greater consistency of tests.

question: Which of the following can be considered as success factors when deploying a new tool in an organization?

answers.A: Providing coaching to users and defining usage guidelines
answers.B: Monitoring tool usage and reducing the need for risk analysis
answers.C: Improving processes and focusing more on component testing
answers.D: Assessing testing completion and minimizing code reviews

question: What is the purpose of exit criteria?

answers.A: To define when a test level is complete.
answers.B: To determine when a test has completed.
answers.C: To identify when a software system should be retired.
answers.D: To determine whether a test has passed.

question: Which test design technique relies heavily on prior thorough knowledge of the system?
With which of the following categories is a test comparator tool USUALLY associated?

answers.A: Tool support for performance and monitoring.
answers.C: Tool support for test execution and logging.
answers.D: Tool support for the management of testing and tests.

question: Which activities form part of test planning?
sub_question:
i) Developing test cases.
ii) Defining the overall approach to testing.
iii) Assigning resources.
iv) Building the test environment
v) Writing test conditions.

answers.A: i, ii & iv are true, iii & v are false.
answers.B: ii & iii are true, i, iv & v are false.
answers.C: iv & v are true, i, ii & iii are false.
answers.D: i, ii & iii are true iv & v are false.

question: Match the following terms and statements.
sub_question:
1.Decision Table Testing
2.Decision Testing
3.State Transition Testing
4.Exploratory Testing


W. Testing carried out w boxes to achieve specific test objectives, possibly to complement structured testing.
X. A test technique used which may be used to verify different system re depending on current conditions or previous history.
Y. A test technique which combines combinations of inputs that might not otherwise have been exercised during testing.
Z. A form of control flow testing based on decision outcomes.

question: Which type of test design techniques does the following statement best describe a procedure to derive test cases based on the specification of a component?
For which of the following would a static analysis tool be MOST useful?

answers.C: Testing code executed in a special test harness.

question: Which test approaches or strategies are characterized by the descriptions below?
sub_question:
S. Process-compliant approaches
T. Heuristic approaches
U. Consultative approaches
V. Regression-averse approaches

1. Includes reuse of existing test material
2. Listens to suggestions from technology experts
3. Adheres to industry-specific standards
4. Runs test execution and evaluation concurrently

question: What principle is BEST described when test designs are written by a third party?
Which of the following is a benefit of test independence?

answers.A: It does not require familiarity with the code.
answers.B: It is cheaper than using developers to test their own code.
answers.C: It avoids author bias in defining effective tests.
answers.D: Testers are better at finding defects than developers.

question: Which of the following is MOST characteristic of specification based (black-box) techniques?

answers.A: Test cases can be easily automated.
answers.B: Test cases are independent of each other.
answers.C: Test cases are derived systematically from models of the system .
answers.D: Test cases are derived systematically from the delivered code.

question: Which of the following combinations correctly describes a valid approach to component testing:
sub_question:
i) Functional testing of the component in isolation.
ii) Structure-based testing of the code without recording incidents.
iii) Automated tests that are run until the component passes.
iv) Functional testing of the interfaces between modules.

question: Which of the following is a KEY test control task?
What is the name of a skeletal implementation of a software component that is used for testing?
Which is the best definition of complete testing:

answers.A: You have discovered every bug in the program.
answers.B: You have tested every statement, branch, and combination of branches in the program.
answers.C: You have completed every test in the test plan.
answers.D: You have reached the scheduled ship date.

question: Complete statement and branch coverage means:

answers.A: That you have tested every statement in the program.
answers.B: That you have tested every statement and every branch in the program.
answers.C: That you have tested every IF statement in the program.
answers.D: That you have tested every combination of values of IF statements in the program

question: There are several risks of managing your project's schedule with a statistical reliability model. These include (choose one or more of the following):

answers.A: Testers spend more energy early in the product trying to find bugs than preparing to do the rest of the project's work more efficiently
answers.B: Managers might not realize that the testing effort is ineffective, late in the project, because they expect a low rate of bug finding, so the low rate achieved doesn't alarm them.
answers.C: It can increase the end-of-project pressure on testers to not find bugs, or to not report bugs.

question: Typical defects that are easier to find in reviews than in dynamic testing are:

answers.D: Insufficient maintainability and incorrect interface specifications

question: Reviews, static analysis and dynamic testing have the same objective
What techniques would be MOST appropriate if the specifications are outdated?
Measurement dysfunction is a problem because:

answers.A: Even though the numbers you look at appear better, to achieve these numbers, people are doing other aspects of their work much less well.
answers.B: We don't know how to measure a variable (our measurement is dysfunctional) and so we don't know how to interpret the result.
answers.C: You are measuring the wrong thing and thus reaching the wrong conclusions.
